title: when/if onTextMessage throws exception connection is "quietly" closed without explanation
body:
### Describe the bug

i had some code like this:

```java
        @OnTextMessage
        Uni<Map<String, Object>> onMessage(JsonNode msg, WebSocketClientConnection connection) {
            boolean succes = msg.get("success").asBoolean();

            logger.info("onTextMessage: " + msg + " succes: " + succes);

            if (!succes) {
                logger.error("Error from Home Assistant: " + msg.get("message").asText());
                return null;
            }
```

which i looked at for a long time to grok why I couldn't figure out why the output was just empty.

I enabled traffic logging and I got:

```posh
2024-08-15 10:06:03,400 DEBUG [io.qua.web.nex.traffic] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-0) [client] connection opened: /api/websocket, Connection[clientId=io.quarkiverse.homeassistant.runtime.HomeAssistantWS$ClientEndpoint, id=7c72217f-0b13-440f-9f7e-5e392a5cf14f], Handshake headers[]

2024-08-15 10:06:03,400 DEBUG [io.qua.web.nex.traffic] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-0) [client] received text message, Connection[clientId=io.quarkiverse.homeassistant.runtime.HomeAssistantWS$ClientEndpoint, id=7c72217f-0b13-440f-9f7e-5e392a5cf14f], Payload: 
{"type":"auth_required","ha_version":"2023.3.1"}
2024-08-15 10:06:03,401 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) web 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT on JVM (powered by Quarkus 3.12.2) started in 0.313s. Listening on: http://localhost:8080
2024-08-15 10:06:03,401 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) Profile dev activated. Live Coding activated.
2024-08-15 10:06:03,401 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) Installed features: [cdi, homeassistant, jfr, opentelemetry, qute, qute-web, rest, rest-client, rest-client-jackson, rest-qute, smallrye-context-propagation, vertx, websockets-next]
2024-08-15 10:06:03,401 INFO  [io.qua.dep.dev.RuntimeUpdatesProcessor] (Aesh InputStream Reader) Live reload total time: 0.342s 
2024-08-15 10:06:03,403 DEBUG [io.qua.web.nex.traffic] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-0) [client] connection closed, Connection[clientId=io.quarkiverse.homeassistant.runtime.HomeAssistantWS$ClientEndpoint, id=7c72217f-0b13-440f-9f7e-5e392a5cf14f]
```

wondering why client connection was closed I enabled full quarkus.debug logging and in between everyting was this debug log:

```
2024-08-15 10:09:13,360 DEBUG [io.qua.web.nex.run.Endpoints] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-4) Connection closed due to unhandled failure java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode.asBoolean()" because the return value of "com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode.get(String)" is null: WebSocket client connection [id=58fc1f2a-3e0e-4d83-abd0-8da44413ab4a, clientId=io.quarkiverse.homeassistant.runtime.HomeAssistantWS$ClientEndpoint]
```

so error was because I accidentally threw an exception by accident.

### Expected behavior

1) error printed about exception happening when calling onMessage - why should that be hidden?

2) have client traffic logging include cause/reason on errors
